alert_tip: When a user asks a question, the retrieved document segments will be passed to the AI model, which will answer the user's question based on the passed segments. You can use recall testing to enter a question and view the matched document segments and similarity
mode_mix_desc: Simultaneously execute three retrieval modes, use RRF algorithm for sorting, and select results that better match the user's question from the three query results. Hybrid retrieval balances semantic similarity and logical correlation, improving retrieval accuracy and the credibility of generated results through complementary advantages
mode_vector_desc: Convert user questions into vectors and match similarity with knowledge base segments, returning results with high similarity. Vector retrieval excels at semantic similarity matching and large-scale unstructured data processing, but lacks interpretability and precise relationship verification
mode_graph_desc: Retrieve knowledge related to user questions through relationship reasoning. Knowledge graph retrieval excels at precise entity relationship reasoning and logic verification, but has weak support for unstructured text and semantic fuzzy queries
mode_fulltext_desc: Match words in documents through word segmentation and return text fragments containing these words
tooltip_top_k: Maximum number of segments to retrieve from the knowledge base, minimum is 1, maximum is 10. The more segments retrieved, the more tokens consumed.
tooltip_similarity_threshold: During retrieval, only text segments with similarity greater than the threshold will be retrieved. Value range: 0~1, the larger the threshold, the more accurate the answer, recommended not to exceed 0.9
